qas.question: Who is credited with discovering zinc?
What two people discovered the electrochemical properties of zinc?
Where can you find zinc chloride?
Who is credited as giving zinc its name?
What does the name zinc or zinke mean?
What is the most common use for zinc?
What is a common use for zinc chloride?
Who is credited with hiding zinc?
What single person discovered the electrochemical properties of zinc?
Where can you lose zinc chloride?
What is the most rare use for zinc?

context: The element was probably named by the alchemist <a0_0><a5_0><b10_0>Paracelsus<b10_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/> after the German word <a1_0>Zinke<a1_0/> <a6_0>(prong, tooth)<a6_0/>. German chemist <a2_0><a7_0><b11_0>Andreas Sigismund Marggraf<b11_0/><a7_0/><a2_0/> is credited with discovering pure metallic zinc in 1746. Work by <a3_0>Luigi Galvani and <b12_0>Alessandro Volta<b12_0/><a3_0/> uncovered the electrochemical properties of zinc by 1800. Corrosion-resistant zinc plating of iron <a8_0>(<b14_0>hot-dip galvanizing<b14_0/><a8_0/>) is the major application for zinc. Other applications are in batteries, small non-structural castings, and alloys, such as brass. A variety of zinc compounds are commonly used, such as zinc carbonate and zinc gluconate (as dietary supplements), zinc chloride (in <a4_0><a9_0><b13_0>deodorants<b13_0/><a9_0/><a4_0/>), zinc pyrithione (anti-dandruff shampoos), zinc sulfide (in luminescent paints), and zinc methyl or zinc diethyl in the organic laboratory.
